sentences.sContent: ...will argue in a forthcoming book that college administrations are overly concerned with the social and athletic activities of their students...
...If schools allow student-athletes to regularly miss out on instructional time for the sake of traveling to athletic competitions...
...reducing or eliminating these opportunities would most likely deprive disadvantaged students of the benefits from athletic participation...
...the University of Arkansas's Anna Egalite finds that athletic coaches in Florida mostly tend to perform just as well as their non-coaching counterparts...
...Amanda Ripley thinks that athletic coaches are poor at classroom instruction...
...even in the cases where the employee is a teacher first and athletic coach second...
...A rigorous study finds that athletic coaches also do well in raising students' test scores...
...A similar test can also measure how quickly subjects associate stereotypical traits—such as athletic skills or mental ability—with a particular group...
...like panic over lead in synthetic athletic fields...
...and there was no established athletic footwear industry in North America from which to recruit those knowledgeable in the field...
...One of the major producers of athletic footwear...
...Knight moved on to do graduate work at Stanford University; his MBA thesis was on marketing athletic shoes...

synos.tran: 运动的，运动员的；体格健壮的

words.tran: 运动员，体育家；身强力壮的人
崇尚运动，竞技热；运动竞赛

trans.tranOther: physically strong and good at sport
